profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 00:17

did.abstract: Collection consists of black and white glass lantern slides of Japanese arts of all periods, pre-historic to the mid-20th century. Includes architecture, painting, sculpture, arms and armor, calligraphy, ceramics, enamel, furniture, lacquer, metalwork and textiles.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University. Further use of this material may be subject to the copyright laws of the United States (Title 17, United States Code) or to site license or other rights management terms or conditions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of black and white glass lantern slides of Japanese arts of all periods, pre-historic to the mid-20th century. Includes architecture, painting, sculpture, arms and armor, calligraphy, ceramics, enamel, furniture, lacquer, metalwork and textiles.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by medium. Further sub-divided by location or chronological period, and if known, by individual artist name.

did.unittitle: Kako genzai inga kyo (Sutra of Past and Present Karma)
